content.description:
No idea on the grade... It has not been freed. Apparently it has been aided, but no grade was given.

 This potential route attracts enormous attention because of the enticing nature of the fist crack running under its huge roof. Learn to climb hanging upside-down for about 15 feet and this wild line could be yours.

This is a long, arching, overhanging crack in the dihedral. The crack starts in solid rock as thin fingers, then at 10 feet opens up into a nice hand crack. About 30 feet up, things get a bit dicey when the crack arches left into an area of looser rock.
content.location: See map. Second dihedral south of the waterfall access.

content.description: This route lies in the first dihedral north of Wide Glide. Climb through 3 small roofs 25 feet up, and continue to the top.
content.location: See map. The first dihedral north of Wide Glide.

content.description: This climb follows the rotten 6th dihedral to the right from waterfall access. (Second dihedral North of Wide Glide.) Thrash your way up the dirty, loose, gnarly crack and claim the ascent!
content.location: See map. The 6th dihedral south of the waterfall access.

content.description:
Layback and jam the first 30 feet, power up and over the roof, and continue up the gravel-filled offwidth to the top.

 5.9 variation -- The Mantle: begin with a challenging mantle onto the short ledge six feet off the ground, on the short face to the right of LM Crack. Then climb the face above to the roof of LM Crack.
content.location: Crack in the fifth dihedral to the right (S) of the waterfall access.

content.description: Climb directly up the south-facing rippled face, just left of LM Crack. The route actually ends on the ledge 30 feet up, but a slight move to the right will allow one to pick up the upper jam crack of LM Crack.
content.location: See map. Just to the right of LM Crack.

content.description:
Climb the jutting outside corner to the left of Ode to Allen.

 5.10 variation: Start on Green Savior, then traverse left into the vertical crack 12 feet above the roof. Climb to the top, using the crack and some good face holds.
content.location: The corner to the left of Ode to Allen.

content.description: A set of dihedrals with a handful of climbs.
